cases.title: Roman Rubble
cases.subtitle: A theft from the Eternal City
cases.crime: The founding cornerstone of the Colosseum has been stolen — an irreplaceable piece of Roman history!

rome.witness: The thief was definitely a man — big and broad-shouldered. He was carrying a gym bag, if you can believe it.
rome.search: You find a crumpled ticket stub for a bullfight in Madrid!
rome.crimenet: Al: 'Surveillance cams caught a large male at Fiumicino Airport. He booked a flight to a city famous for its Royal Palace and flamenco dancing.'

madrid.witness: He had the most striking brown hair and these enormous eyebrows — like two caterpillars fighting over his forehead.
madrid.search: You discover a pub receipt. The logo reads: 'The Red Lion, London.' Printed just yesterday.
madrid.crimenet: Al: 'Airport records show a passenger matching our suspect heading for an island nation known for Big Ben and double-decker buses.'

london.witness: Oh yes, I remember him! Blue eyes, couldn't miss 'em. He kept flexing in the shop window reflections. A real bodybuilder type.
london.search: Tucked behind a phone box: a torn brochure for the Eiffel Tower with a hotel address scrawled in pencil.
london.crimenet: Al: 'He's heading for the city of lights — wine, fashion, and a very famous iron tower. Vive la France!'

paris.witness: He was here! He had a huge duffel bag and those ridiculous bushy eyebrows. He headed toward the Louvre district.
paris.search: A VILE calling card: 'Better luck next time, Detective.' The criminal is cornered — make your arrest!
paris.crimenet: Al: 'This is it — your suspect is in Paris. Get that warrant ready and bring them in!'

cases.briefingText: Rookie! Good to have you on board. I'm Dr. Kenny, ACME's Chief Science Officer. Bad news — V.I.L.E. has struck the Colosseum in Rome. They've stolen the founding cornerstone! It's one of the oldest artifacts in European history. We need you to track down the thief and recover it. Start in Rome — the trail is fresh!
cases.debriefText: Excellent work, Agent! Nick Brunt is behind bars, and the cornerstone is on its way back to Rome. You've made your first arrest for ACME — but this is just the beginning. V.I.L.E. won't stop here.

cases.title: Pharaoh's Fury
cases.subtitle: Robbery on the banks of the Nile
cases.crime: Tutankhamun's golden death mask has been stolen from the Cairo Museum — one of the world's most precious archaeological treasures!

cairo.witness: A woman — blonde hair, very confident. She had a scar on her chin that I'll never forget. She seemed to know exactly what she was doing.
cairo.search: Beneath a display case: a fragment of a Turkish Airlines boarding pass — destination Istanbul.
cairo.crimenet: Al: 'She boarded a flight east — to a city that bridges two continents, spanning the Bosphorus Strait between Europe and Asia.'

istanbul.witness: Yes, a woman with green eyes — like emeralds. She asked about ferries to Greece. Something about the Acropolis.
istanbul.search: You find a partially burned map. The circle drawn on it marks a city with ancient columns and a famous hilltop temple.
istanbul.crimenet: Al: 'Uncle Silas radioed in — he spotted a blonde woman matching our suspect buying a ferry ticket toward the Greek capital.'

athens.witness: She had such a strange hobby — she was humming some kind of fuse-lighting song under her breath. She mentioned going north, to a city of music.
athens.search: A note in the suspect's handwriting: 'V — Vienna. Don't be late.' Vienna — Austria's imperial capital!
athens.crimenet: Al: 'She is heading to the city of Mozart — the former heart of the Habsburg Empire, known for its grand Opera House.'

vienna.witness: She was here! Blonde, scar on her chin, and she smelled faintly of gunpowder. She left in quite a hurry.
vienna.search: The stolen mask's protective casing — she left it behind. She's nearby. Time for the arrest!
vienna.crimenet: Al: 'Vienna is the final stop. Move in — your warrant had better be ready!'

cases.briefingText: Hey, rookie. Al here. So Cairo got hit — Tut's gold mask is gone. Nasty business. Our field veteran, Uncle Silas, is already in the region. He'll radio in tips as you go. Start at the Cairo Museum — witnesses are still shaken up. And watch yourself — whoever did this knows their explosives.
cases.debriefText: Cairo's got its mask back — nice work. Uncle Silas says he could've done it faster, but don't take it personally. That's just how he is. Sarah Nade will be cooling off in an ACME cell for a very long time.

cases.title: Jade Dragon
cases.subtitle: A heist along the Silk Road
cases.crime: The legendary Imperial Jade Dragon — a priceless Han Dynasty sculpture — has been stolen from the Palace Museum!

beijing.witness: A man with wild red hair and the thickest glasses I've ever seen. He had all sorts of gadgets clipped to his belt.
beijing.search: You find a crumpled brochure for a Korean tech expo in Seoul, annotated with sketches of bizarre inventions.
beijing.crimenet: Al: 'Yu-Fu Chen tracked him to Tianjin Airport — he took a direct flight to the capital of South Korea, famous for its ancient palace Gyeongbokgung.'

seoul.witness: Red hair, hazel eyes — unusual combination. He kept muttering about gyroscopes and anti-gravity. Eccentric, to say the least.
seoul.search: Abandoned on a bench: a half-soldered circuit board and a napkin with 'TOKYO — bullet train' written in marker.
seoul.crimenet: Al: 'He took the Korean Air flight south. Yu-Fu Chen says he's heading to the land of bullet trains, cherry blossoms, and neon lights.'

tokyo.witness: He came through Akihabara — fit right in with his gadgets. He mentioned needing a boat to an island city with amazing food courts.
tokyo.search: A receipt from a Tokyo electronics shop: parts for a 'miniaturized antigravity clamp.' This guy is seriously inventive.
tokyo.crimenet: Al: 'Singapore-bound. The Lion City — tiny island, world-class everything. Yu-Fu Chen has eyes on him.'

singapore.witness: Red hair, thick glasses, always tinkering. He's somewhere in the Marina Bay district with the Dragon.
singapore.search: The Jade Dragon's velvet case — empty. He's close. Make your move!
singapore.crimenet: Al: 'Yu-Fu Chen has him cornered near Marina Bay Sands. Go, go, go!'

cases.briefingText: Agent! I've been analyzing the theft signature — this has V.I.L.E. written all over it. The Imperial Jade Dragon, gone from Beijing's Palace Museum. Our field agent Yu-Fu Chen is already embedded in the region. She'll send me observations that I'll relay to you. Begin in Beijing — someone there saw something.
cases.debriefText: The Jade Dragon is restored to its rightful home. Ivor Idea's gadgets couldn't save him in the end! Yu-Fu Chen sends her regards — she says you have 'adequate instincts.' Coming from her, that's high praise.

cases.title: Amazon Gold
cases.subtitle: Treasure vanishes in the New World
cases.crime: The legendary Aztec Sunstone — the great Calendar Stone of Tenochtitlán — has been pried from its museum mount and stolen!

mexico_city.witness: A woman — black hair, very elegant. She moved like a dancer. Long painted nails, bright red.
mexico_city.search: You find a glossy brochure for a Havana salsa club, with a room number circled: '214.'
mexico_city.crimenet: Al: 'Uncle Silas spotted her at the airport. She's heading south — to an island nation famous for vintage cars, cigars, and incredible music. Think Caribbean.'

havana.witness: She danced through customs like she owned the place. Brown eyes, absolutely regal posture. Said something about the 'Theater of Colón.'
havana.search: A hotel receipt: 'Grand Plaza Havana.' Below it, a scrawled note: 'Next — Lima. See the ruins.'
havana.crimenet: Al: 'She flew south along the Pacific coast — to Peru's capital, gateway to Machu Picchu and Inca gold.'

lima.witness: She hummed something classical as she walked. Ballet, maybe? She had a refined air — and those nails were unforgettable.
lima.search: A torn poster advertising the Teatro Colón in Buenos Aires — her next destination circled in scarlet nail polish.
lima.crimenet: Al: 'Final destination: Buenos Aires. The Paris of South America. Uncle Silas is already there.'

buenos_aires.witness: She was at the Teatro Colón! Beautiful and cold as ice. She left toward the docks.
buenos_aires.search: The Sunstone's transport crate — empty. She's here. Get your warrant!
buenos_aires.crimenet: Al: 'She is in Buenos Aires. Move in — Uncle Silas has her building surrounded!'

cases.briefingText: Big one, Agent. Really big. The Aztec Sunstone — yeah, the giant calendar stone — is GONE. Out of Mexico City's National Museum of Anthropology. They had to use a crane. Whoever this is, they're bold. Start in Mexico City. Uncle Silas will meet you in the field. He's already grumbling about the heat.
cases.debriefText: Nadia Slinsk pirouettes into a jail cell — poetic justice. The Sunstone is on its way home. Uncle Silas says to tell you 'not bad, for a rookie.' I think he's warming up to you.

cases.title: Pacific Heist
cases.subtitle: Stolen across the ocean blue
cases.crime: The Sydney Opera House's iconic architectural blueprints — drawn by Jørn Utzon and never publicly released — have been stolen from the National Archives!

sydney.witness: Blonde bloke with a handle-bar mustache — you couldn't miss him. He was playing poker on his phone while the alarms went off.
sydney.search: A betting slip from an Auckland casino: 'Golden Star Casino, Table 7.' Dated yesterday.
sydney.crimenet: Al: 'He caught a flight across the Tasman Sea — to New Zealand's largest city, the City of Sails, home of Sky Tower.'

auckland.witness: Blue eyes, big mustache, very loud laugh. He kept talking about 'the jackpot.' He booked a flight west — said something about surfing.
auckland.search: A casino chip from the Horseshoe Casino, Honolulu. How did it end up here?
auckland.crimenet: Al: 'He's island-hopping. Next stop: Hawaii — Diamond Head, Waikiki Beach, and a suspiciously large carry-on bag.'

honolulu.witness: Massive mustache, won three thousand dollars at the poker table, then vanished. He mentioned Tokyo — something about a big buyer.
honolulu.search: A first-class Japan Airlines ticket stub — Tokyo, Narita Airport. Business class. V.I.L.E. pays well, apparently.
honolulu.crimenet: Al: 'Final destination: Tokyo, Japan. Bullet trains, cherry blossoms, and one very smug criminal.'

tokyo.witness: He's here in Shinjuku — flashy suit, enormous mustache. He's been gambling in the arcades.
tokyo.search: The blueprints' protective tube — empty. He's nearby. Make your arrest!
tokyo.crimenet: Al: 'He's in Tokyo. Get there before he sells those blueprints! This is it!'

cases.briefingText: Agent, this one has us baffled. V.I.L.E. stole architectural blueprints — Utzon's secret Opera House designs. Why? What are they planning to build? Or copy? The cultural significance alone is staggering. Our suspect seems to be making a game of it — literally. Track them across the Pacific.
cases.debriefText: Lars Vegas cashed out his last chip. The blueprints are safe. But I'm worried, Agent — V.I.L.E. is getting more sophisticated. There's something bigger coming. I can feel it in the data.

cases.title: Northern Lights
cases.subtitle: Darkness falls over Scandinavia
cases.crime: The original Viking longship 'Oseberg' — the world's best-preserved Viking vessel — has been partially dismantled and its prow stolen!

oslo.witness: A woman with wild purple hair and tattoos all over her arms — cyberpunk style. She had grey eyes that seemed to look right through you.
oslo.search: A data chip on the museum floor. ACME tech decrypts it: 'Meet in Amsterdam. Canal house 47.'
oslo.crimenet: Al: 'She hacked the museum CCTV before the theft — very professional. She flew southwest to a city famous for its canals, bicycles, and the Rijksmuseum.'

amsterdam.witness: Purple hair, cyberpunk tattoos — she was typing on three phones at once. She mentioned Berlin, something about 'the handoff.'
amsterdam.search: A crumpled note in code. Yu-Fu Chen cracks it instantly: 'Berlin — Checkpoint Charlie, midnight.'
amsterdam.crimenet: Al: 'Yu-Fu Chen is tracking her east — to Germany's reunified capital, home of the Brandenburg Gate.'

berlin.witness: The woman with the tattoos — she was here at Checkpoint Charlie. Grey eyes, very intense. She left toward the east.
berlin.search: A hacked transit receipt: a train ticket from Berlin to Prague — booked minutes ago.
berlin.crimenet: Al: 'She is on a train to the Czech Republic — to Prague, the City of a Hundred Spires.'

prague.witness: Purple hair, glowing tattoos. She's near Prague Castle — I saw her climbing the old steps!
prague.search: The Viking prow's custom crating — discarded near the castle gate. She's here!
prague.crimenet: Al: 'Prague. This is it. Yu-Fu Chen has eyes on her. Your warrant better be signed!'

cases.briefingText: Heads up — this one is sophisticated. Someone hacked the Oslo Viking Ship Museum's entire security network, then walked out with a thousand-year-old ship prow. The hack signature... it's like nothing our system has seen. Yu-Fu Chen is already in the field. And between us — Internal Affairs thinks there might be a leak somewhere near ACME. Be careful who you trust.
cases.debriefText: Dee Cryption is in custody, and her devices are being analyzed. But Agent — the mole situation isn't resolved. Someone inside ACME knew our investigation routes. I've flagged it to the Director. Stay sharp.

cases.title: Double Cross
cases.subtitle: Betrayal in the City of Light
cases.crime: The Mona Lisa has been stolen — AGAIN. But this time, the thief left a note addressed directly to you, Detective.

paris.witness: An older gentleman — silver hair, a monocle. Very distinguished. He was humming an aria as he walked past me. Didn't look the least bit suspicious.
paris.search: The note left at the Louvre: 'To the Detective — catch me if you can. Vienna awaits. — V.F.' The arrogance!
paris.crimenet: Al: 'Victor Flauté — we have a name. He has brown eyes and a monocle, and he apparently loves opera. He flew to Austria's imperial capital.'

vienna.witness: He attended the opera last night — front row. Silver hair, monocle, humming along. He checked out this morning, heading south.
vienna.search: A theatre programme from the Vienna State Opera, signed 'V.F.' with an arrow pointing to Rome printed on the cover.
vienna.crimenet: Al: 'He is heading to the Eternal City — Rome. Yu-Fu Chen thinks he plans to sell the Mona Lisa to a private collector there.'

rome.witness: He was here — the man with the monocle! He met someone in secret near the Vatican, then left very quickly northward.
rome.search: A receipt from a Roman antiquities dealer — a deal was struck, but the handover location listed is London.
rome.crimenet: Al: 'London — the handover is happening there. Yu-Fu Chen intercepted the communication. There is also... a disturbing new development. Someone at ACME tipped off Flauté about your route. The mole is real.'

london.witness: Silver hair, monocle, carrying a large flat case. He's at the Savoy Hotel. And Detective — someone told him you were coming.
london.search: The Mona Lisa — wrapped in brown paper, hidden in the hotel room. Flauté is here. This is your moment.
london.crimenet: Al: 'Victor Flauté is at the Savoy. But be warned — this is a trap. He knows you're coming. The mole betrayed your position. Go in careful.'

cases.briefingText: Agent. This is unprecedented. The Mona Lisa — stolen again. But here is what disturbs me most: the note left behind was addressed to you, by name. V.I.L.E. knows who you are. And I fear... someone in our organization may have told them. I hate saying it, but the evidence is there. Complete this case, but trust no one until we identify the mole.
cases.debriefText: Victor Flauté is in custody and the Mona Lisa is restored to the Louvre. But the mole — we found them. I won't say the name over this channel. The Director has been notified. There is one more case, Agent. The biggest one. Carmen Sandiego herself is making her move.

cases.title: The Final Chase
cases.subtitle: Carmen Sandiego — end of the line
cases.crime: Carmen Sandiego has stolen something unprecedented: the ACME Master Database — containing the identities of every ACME agent worldwide. She must be stopped.

new_york.witness: All I saw was a shadow — a figure in a red coat, masked. They moved like smoke through a crowd. Gone before anyone could react.
new_york.search: A single playing card: the Ace of Spades. On the back, written in elegant script: 'Meet me where the pharaohs sleep.'
new_york.crimenet: Al: 'The Shadow — Carmen in disguise, or one of her finest operatives. Uncle Silas and Yu-Fu Chen are both mobilizing. First stop: Egypt, where the Great Pyramid stands.'

cairo.witness: A masked figure in black — no visible features. They bought a flight ticket and slipped into the crowd. The hair that showed was jet black.
cairo.search: A coded message left at the pyramid: three symbols that Yu-Fu Chen decodes to read 'SAKURA.' Cherry blossoms. Japan.
cairo.crimenet: Al: 'The Shadow is heading east — to Japan. Tokyo. Uncle Silas and Yu-Fu Chen are converging there.'

tokyo.witness: They were here — masked, silent. They left a message at the ACME satellite office: a red origami bird with 'Paris' written on one wing.
tokyo.search: A red origami crane. Unfolded: a map of Paris with the Eiffel Tower circled. This is the final confrontation.
tokyo.crimenet: Al: 'Paris. Everyone is converging on Paris. This is it, Agent — the endgame. Dr. Kenny has your final warrant ready. The Shadow. Carmen. Bring them home.'

paris.witness: The masked figure — at the top of the Eiffel Tower! I saw them watching the city. They are waiting for you.',
paris.search: The ACME database drive — placed in plain sight on a bench, like a taunt. The Shadow is here. This. Is. It.
paris.crimenet: Al: 'All ACME units are standing by. Dr. Kenny has every warrant we've ever issued ready to go. Make the final arrest, Detective. End this.'
paris.fieldNote: Yu-Fu Chen: 'The trail ends here. I have never hunted anyone like this. Be ready for anything.' | Uncle Silas: 'I've been chasing Carmen Sandiego my entire career. Don't let her slip through your fingers, rookie.'

cases.briefingText: Agent... she's come out of the shadows. Carmen Sandiego herself has struck ACME headquarters. The Master Database — every agent's identity, every case file, every ACME safehouse in the world — is gone. This isn't just a theft. It's a declaration of war. Yu-Fu Chen and Uncle Silas are both in the field. This is everything we've worked toward. Bring her in.
cases.debriefText: You did it. After all these cases, all these cities — Carmen Sandiego is in custody. The database is recovered. ACME agents worldwide are safe. The world's treasures are going home. I... I don't quite know what to say. You walked in here as a rookie, and you just caught the most elusive criminal in history. The Director has one thing to say: Welcome to the top, Super-Sleuth.
